title: Esure's director buys first shares two days after joining board

Fri, Aug 14, 2015, 17:15 BST - UK Markets closed Esure's director buys first shares two days after joining board By Jessica Fino | Sharecast – 17 minutes ago 976.00 +4.0000 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Esure's new director Martin Pike bought his first shares in the company two days after joining the personal lines insurer. The non-executive director purchased 400,000 shares for an individual price of 235.5p, spending a total of £942,000 in the transaction. 
Pike is also a director at Standard Life (LSE: SL.L - news ) and the chairman of Greencore Construction. 
On Wednesday, the company also announced Mike Evans has decided to step down as a non-executive director due to a potential conflict of interest following Zoopla's acquisition of uSwitch.
